intro: Hosackia wrightii, commonly known as Wright's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid environments. Hosackia wrightii is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
